逃.definition: to escape; to run away; to flee

逃不出.definition: unable to escape; can't get out

逃之夭夭.definition: to escape without trace (idiom); to make one's getaway (from the scene of a crime); to show a clean pair of heels

逃亡.definition: to flee; to go into exile

逃命.definition: to escape; to flee; to run for one's life

逃單.definition: to dine and dash; (by extension) to avoid paying a bill

逃奔.definition: to run away to; to flee

逃婚.definition: to flee to avoid an arranged marriage

逃學.definition: to play truant; to cut classes

逃席.definition: to leave a banquet (without taking one's leave)

逃往.definition: to run away; to go into exile

逃港.definition: to flee to Hong Kong; exodus to Hong Kong (from mainland China, 1950s-1970s); to flee Hong Kong; exodus from Hong Kong (from 2020)

逃犯.definition: escaped criminal; fugitive from the law

逃獄.definition: to escape (from prison); to jump bail

逃票.definition: to sneak in without a ticket; to stow away

逃竄.definition: to run away; to flee in disarray

逃竄無蹤.definition: to disperse and flee, leaving no trace

逃荒.definition: to escape from a famine; to get away from a famine-stricken region

逃走.definition: to escape; to flee; to run away

逃跑.definition: to flee from sth; to run away; to escape

逃逸.definition: to escape; to run away; to abscond

逃過一劫.definition: (idiom) to survive a calamity; to get through a crisis

逃避.definition: to escape; to evade; to avoid; to shirk

逃難.definition: to run away from trouble; to flee from calamity; to be a refugee
